Package equipments.HEM

Interface AdjustableCI

All Superinterfaces:
fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.ComponentInterface, fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.RequiredCI
All Known Implementing Classes:
AdjustableOutboundPort, AirConditioningConnector, FridgeConnector
public interface AdjustableCI extends fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.RequiredCI
The component interface AdjustableCI defines the standardised operation that an equipment implements to let a household energy manager adjust or suspend them i.e., making their electric power consumption the lowest possible.

Description

An adjustable equipment is an electric equipment that can be suspended and resumed, in which case it operates at the lowest possible level of power consumption. In some cases, they may provide several distinct operative modes that are designated by integers from 1 to maxMode() that make it operate at increasing levels of power consumption.

Black-box Invariant

 invariant      true        // no more invariant

Created on : 2023-10-16

Author:
Jacques Malenfant, Daniel SIMA

      boolean setMode(int modeIndex) throws Exception
      set the equipment to the given mode of operation, returning true if the operation succeeded or false otherwise.

      Contract

 pre    modeIndex > 0 && modeIndex <= maxMode()
 post   currentMode() == modeIndex
      Parameters:
